üöÄ Mission 11: Dividing Fractions

*Slicing up pizza fractions.*

üìú The Instructions

Dividing Fractions -

Circle fraction manipulatives

This is a Power Lesson. Power lessons are used to increase your students' level of math mastery. You can do this by submitting a video of your students doing the activity at the end of this lesson or a picture/scan of their written work.

üéí 1. Gear Checklist

Gather these exact items:

Print Circle fraction manipulatives or Pie shapes or find in Family Math kit.

Paper and pencil for each group

üéØ 2. Your Objectives

Fractions as parts of a whole, adding fractions & dividing fractions

Divide fractions with fractions

I can divide two fractions. (6.NS.1a)

I can solve word problems involving the division of fractions by fractions by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem. (6.NS.1b)

I can explain the meaning of the answer (quotient) of fraction division answers. (6.NS.1c)

üó∫Ô∏è 4. The Adventure (Activity)

üìú Verbatim Instructions:

Get the fraction manipulatives ready for the students

Review the rules for dividing fractions.

Ask the students if they had ‚Öî of a pizza and they divide the ‚Öî by ¬Ω how many pieces would they have? Give other similar problems such as ¬æ √∑ ¬º ; ‚Öñ √∑ ¬Ω Your family got 4 kinds of pizza for dinner last night. 1/3 of the pineapple, 1/4 of the pepperoni and 1/2 of the cheese is left. You want to split each kind in 1/2 with your brother. How much pizza will you get?

For some of the online activities you will need a free CK12 account.

To create a CK12 account:

Go to: https://www.ck12.org/student/

Click on the orange JOIN button in the upper right corner

Choose the option for email to sign up.

Enter your student's information. CK12 will ask students to input their teacher email. PLEASE ENTER THE TEACHER'S EMAIL: and the teacher will complete the registration process.

When registration is complete, the teacher will email you the username and password for your student account.

üí° üöÄ Mission Strategy: Step-by-Step

*(Use this guide to help you complete the instructions above)*

1. Grab your circle manipulatives (or cut paper plates).

2. Scenario: You have 2/3 of a pizza.

3. Challenge: Divide that by 1/2. (How many 'halves' fit into 'two-thirds'?)

4. Solve the problem: 'Family Pizza Night'. 1/3 pineapple left. Split that in 1/2. (1/3 divided by 2 = 1/6).
